JPackageCommand.assertFileInAppImage() (https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/4d50df63b6ea76fd6a6c387593c3d6bc9429007b/test/jdk/tools/jpackage/helpers/jdk/jpackage/test/JPackageCommand.java#L882) calls JPackageCommand.appInstallationDirectory(). The later function will return "/" when called on a package installed in "/usr" tree. JPackageCommand.assertFileInAppImage() will then iterate over the files in the returned path value. Iterating the whole file system doesn't make sense. Also calling Path.getFileName() on "/" returns null and results in NPE.

On Linux if appInstallationDirectory() returns "/" don't call Files.walk("/"). Instead, get the list of files in Linux package (.deb or .rpm) with LinuxHelper.getPackageFiles() call. Also, swap objects in Object.equals() call to avoid NPEs (will occur for .deb packages as they contain "./" directory), i.e. replace "path.getFileName().equals(filename)" with "filename.equals(path.getFileName())".
